meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah tried to outyell her friend to be heard over the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The fans in the stadium outyell each other to show their support for the team.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outyell each other to see who can be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the howls of the wolves outyell any other sound.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm seemed to outyell the roaring wind with its deafening noise.

meanings.sent1: The cheerleader managed to outyell her teammates during the pep rally.
meanings.sent2: In the competition, the singer outyelled the other contestants with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully outyell each other to see who can be the most energetic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outyelled the noise of the party, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock seemed to outyell all other sounds, waking up the entire household.
